panels.description: The percentage of responses that can be served from the backup cache on an upstream outage.

targets.expr: sum(rate(gitpod_openvsx_proxy_backup_cache_hit_total{cluster=~"$cluster", pod=~"$pod", instance=~"$container_instance"}[1m])) / (sum(rate(gitpod_openvsx_proxy_backup_cache_hit_total{cluster=~"$cluster", pod=~"$pod", instance=~"$container_instance"}[1m])) + sum(rate(gitpod_openvsx_proxy_backup_cache_miss_total{cluster=~"$cluster", pod=~"$pod", instance=~"$container_instance"}[1m])))

panels.title: Backup Cache Hits

panels.description: The percentage of served responses from the regular cache.

targets.expr: sum(rate(gitpod_openvsx_proxy_regular_cache_hit_and_serve_total{cluster=~"$cluster", pod=~"$pod", instance=~"$container_instance"}[1m])) / (sum(rate(gitpod_openvsx_proxy_regular_cache_hit_and_serve_total{cluster=~"$cluster", pod=~"$pod", instance=~"$container_instance"}[1m])) + sum(rate(gitpod_openvsx_proxy_regular_cache_miss_total{cluster=~"$cluster", pod=~"$pod", instance=~"$container_instance"}[1m])))

panels.title: Regular Cache Hits

panels.description: The number/percentage of responses that are actually served from the backup cache due to an upstream outage.
panels.title: Served Responses from Backups Cache

panels.description: Table of the total number of requests by path and status. The path is truncated after 3 segments.
panels.title: Total Number of Requests

panels.description:
Saturation > 100% means that the container is requesting more than its limits.

Kubernetes will start to throttle CPU when that happens. That's a sign of degraded performance.

'No Data' indicates that the pod has no CPU limits.
panels.title: CPU Saturation

targets.expr: sum(container_memory_working_set_bytes{container!="POD", container!="", cluster=~"$cluster", node=~"$node", pod=~"$pod"}) by (pod, cluster, node)

panels.description:
Memory can't be throttled. When a container reaches 100% of its memory limits,  Kubernetes will kill the container and restart it.

'No Data' indicates that the pod doesn't have Memory limits.
panels.title: Memory Saturation
